cause.description:
There has been a "coming soon" sign for several years now and it's time for the park to be opened for all to use. Our neighborhood, and Los Angeles in general, is park-poor and the fact that the only progress that has been made has been to fence this large swath of grass is disgraceful and inexcusable. The timing couldn't be more appropriate with summer right around the corner. Finally, opening this park will cost very little since the grounds are already landscaped.
What you can (and should) do: Contact the Politicians: •Representative Henry Waxman: (310) 652-3095 or http://www.house.gov/waxman/contact.htm •Senator Barbara Boxer: (213) 894-5000 or http://boxer.senate.gov/contact/email/policy.cfm •Senator Dianne Feinstein: (310) 914-7300 or http://feinstein.senate.gov/public/index.cfm?FuseAction=ContactUs.EmailMe •Mayor Antonio Villaraigosa: (213) 978-0600 or mayor@lacity.org •Councilman Bill Rosendahl: (310) 575-8461 or councilman.rosendahl@lacity.org •Supervisor Zev Yaroslavsky: (213) 974-3333 or zev@bos.lacounty.gov •Governor Arnold Schwarzenegger: (213) 897-0322 or http://www.govmail.ca.gov/
(This is not about donating to Little League Baseball, although you may do that if you so choose. It is only on here because Facebook required me to link this to a nonprofit in their network.)
1. Parks are a fundamental right.
2. Los Angeles has too few parks.
3. The expensive gates that were installed at the site should be thrown open to allow access to the green space for all.
cause.mission: Urge the powers that be to finally open the Veteran's Park at the corner of Wilshire Bl. & San Vicente Bl. in West LA.
cause.name: Open Veteran's Park Already
